intro: Schwannia elegans, commonly known as the elegant schwannia, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Schwannia elegans typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in shaded to partially sunny environments. It is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ease of cultivation.
